8.18.19  5:57 pm   Do you think that it's possible to force yourself to be smart/intelligent?
I just don't think I've ever been smart.. Sure, I had all A's in school when I was younger, but that was due to my extreme perfectionism. at the time i thought that if i ever were to get a grade lower than A, i'd instantly fail in life and die.
People who are naturally intelligent remain being intelligent until they die. I was a "smart" kid back then, but now I'm average at best when it comes to intelligence. Some of my good friends even consider me extremely dumb. Am I just going through a "dumb" phase right now or have I always been dumb? I'm not sure..

      if someone purports to be giving you a grade indicating intelligence, they are faking and would have no basis or means to do that unless they were intrinsically some kind of higher being

8.18.19  5:51 pm   Can you explain the economy in simple concepts I can hopefully understand?

     i will try

      Especially how money is made. Governments print as much money as they want, but somehow people say that it's banks that create money. How do they do that?

     the banks invented money. they had the original idea for it, so they get to collect on intellectual properties. ....i think?

      And why is money worth a little less each year, like my mother used to pay 50 cents for a pound of butter but now that barely buys you a tablespoon or something. I understand money locally. People give me money when I do what they want. I just don't understand the big picture of it. Any pointers?

     its potency wears off gradually

      maybe 4 or 5

8.18.19  2:16 pm   Why haven't you made a video for 5 months?

      the first week i was trying to make one insanely quickly. the second week i was feeling yet again bad and shameful for being unable to execute them at that pace. then for the next 3 weeks or so i was making the song for the video. then, when i began the video, a little tickle in my mind was telling me 'you know that little 3d program i use for occasional little bits of things sometimes, well maybe i should actually just try to start the whole video on there and see what happens.' then i had my mind blown in more different ways and angles than i ever knew existed. 2 months deep into this wild ride, it occured to me that now might actually be the most fine time to go ahead and do what is known as the 'finalcut transition', which long story short means i have to entirely abandon the primary video editing software i have used for the last 5 years. the reason for that is because it was discontinued in 2011. i had been delaying this moment for the past 5 years, because as i always used to say, 'there's never a good time to re-learn everything i know, especially because i've been getting better and better at it every day for the last 5 years.' But, here i was, suddenly doing most of my work in a different program which has the distinct advantage of being available on computers made later than 2014. so being aware of that, a spectacular cascade of events suddenly began to unfold, which i can possibly trace back to viewing a youtube rental of spiderman into the spider verse, for which the only way i could watch it was on a borrowed computer, because my main computer had finally become officially too old to play the movie with ANY browser. that realization, combined with seeing how much faster this borrowed computer was from mine (despite actually being the same age), combined with the outrageousness of the visual effects in that particular movie, combined with the previously mentioned reasons for being ready to make the transition, i decided to reach deep into the savings acount and see if i can make things a little more interesting ............

8.17.19  10:24 pm   will you please ask me a question. i will attempt to answer it

      when viewing the console on mac os, is there any way to actually get the thing to stop moving, because unclicking the 'now' button doesn't seem to be doing it. it still moves. also do you know of a way to exclude things categorically one at a time, (i.e., hide all webkit processes, hide all processes named xyz, etc)

8.17.19  10:15 pm   Hello Bill. which method do you think is the best way to organize your music? I have lots of music on my archive that i've collected over the course of 20 years and that i deeply care about (i hate all sorts of streaming sites). And i've put a lot of effort into shaping my music directory and now i am looking at it thinking if i can use more simplified method. 

      it seems as long as you have a search function, i don't find it necessary to organize other than to have all the music in one place

8.17.19  10:02 pm   was thinking it would be cool to see like 3d fluid models sloshing around in your videos

      that's true

8.17.19  10:01 pm   hello bill, i have been struggling with understanding chords and how they work. the possibilities seem endless and there seem to be so many things at play. what i would like to achieve is to be able to identify what i want when writing a chord progression more quickly. for example i want to begin writing a song and then say "oh a sharp 9 would be great here" without trying to figure it out for hours. do you have any tips on just being able to use my ears like that? thanks.

      songs. learn a lot of songs. hear them, love them, (if you don't then try the next one) and learn what's in all of them. soon you'll seem to know everything, which is surprising, because scientists don't know any of this stuff
